The close proximity to places like Maine and Maryland mean crab cakes and other such eastern delicacies are at the ready for prices we can only dream about on the West Coast. On my last particular visit, their 11.99/lb. baccala was on my mind. A staple in many European countries, and something that is just so luxurious and easy to work with-- dry salted cod sounds simple, but is both easy to mess up (in terms of quality) and difficult to find. Two generous slabs ran just above a pound and travels well. A must-try for seafood lovers.

Specializing in craft beer and wine, this place is one of the better bottle shops I have seen on this side of the country. While the wine selections aren't much, it's their incredibly well-stocked beer fridge that is the star. They had an incredible amount of international selections- better than most larger stores with ties to major distributors. I came home with a few prized bottles including 3 Belgian gems including a beautiful farmhouse Saison from Fantome. Prices were reasonable and there is also a tasting area for those who want to open up their bottles or try any of their wine and cheese pairings.

Very much a touristy thing to do, but that doesn't make it any less awesome.  The Deep Sea Tasting Room is on the harbor, which is a good place to have a SB experience.  The wine, albeit, is not amazing.  The prices are average, but I have not been impressed by the flights.  I'd recommend getting a glass of your fave, in order to avoid tasting some not-so-good wines.  However, the staff here is super friendly and you can't beat the view!  I wish they had more/better furniture in the outdoor patio.  But, really I am just nitpicking - go to Deep Sea Tasting Room if you enjoy sipping wine with an ocean view.  And who doesn't?

Yes, we are health freaks, but really... they have probably the best burgers and fries I've had.  I rarely eat red meat... let alone with a side of deep-fried potatoes... but I will stretch to make excuses to eat here ("I was in Vegas all weekend and still need to soak up the alcohol.... I went to the gym everyday this week, my body probably needs protein...").  Hey, I didn't say they were good excuses.

I tried the turkey burger once, which is usually my go to if I'm craving a burger... but I say, splurge for the classic cheeseburger and fries.  This is a once-a-year treat, but so worth the wait!

If you could go to one tasting place in Santa Barbara, I'd recommend this one!  Although I love Kalyra wines, I think this place is fun because they have so much of a variety, with wine and beer flights.  They have a traditional beer tastings, as well as fruit beers.  You can apply the flight price to your wine/beer purchase, which is always a plus.  

The flights are pretty affordable (normal for the area), with a range of options for different prices (i.e., chardonnay/white tastings are cheaper than some cab/red tastings).  

This is the best place to take a group, even if they are newbies to the wine/beer tasting world.  The location is great - take a walk along the coast after you taste!

The only reason I give this place four stars instead of five, is because the staff weren't the friendliest.  Not rude, but not nice and welcoming either.  But I've only been here once, so maybe next time my experience with the staff would be different.

Love the concept of this place, love the food even more.

The bf and I shared a Backyard Bowl for a Saturday afternoon snack.  The fruit was fresh, the bee pollen was sweet, the goji berries were chewy, the granola was crunchy, and the blended smoothie part was refreshing.  Just a perfect, perfect combination of fresh, (mostly) organic and local foods.  It is a little pricey, but you get what you pay for... and it's definitely worth it!  I want to go back and try the other bowls... but you have to be careful with calories on these.  Although it sounds and tastes healthy, I think it's better to share a bowl unless it's your lunch (forgive me, I'm on a calorie-counting kick right now).

I also really like this location.  A walk from the major shops downtown, and there is an open-walled outdoor area to eat and enjoy the Santa Barbara breeze.

I love this farmer's market!  It's tucked away in a street a couple blocks from downtown.  There's always a musician or two lightening the mood, as well as the balloon animal maker.  

My favorites:

*Autumn - grape stand, especially the lychee grapes and big, crunchy grapes
*Winter - persimmons, sugar snap peas, carrots
*Spring/Summer - all stone fruits!  
*Year-round - bread

Yes, prices are pretty high relative to other places in California, but normal for Santa Barbara.

Thanks Cat Cora for the recommendation.  Casey and I have ventured up the mountains of Santa Barbara to satisfy our tri-tip craving two or three times now, ever since hearing about this place.  On the weekends (and I think just Sundays during non-summer months), they do their famous tri-tip sandwiches that you order in the bar (pay attention, because it's not obvious to figure out), and then you take your sandwich ticked up to the grill.  They give you a hefty portion of tri-tip laid on an oh-so melt-in-your-mouth roll.  There's a couple sauces and au jus to choose from.  And then you eat.  Perfection.  There are plenty of places to sit outside, accompanied by several biker dudes/chicks.  Great place to go if you're visiting SB or if you live in SB and have visitors (carnivores).
Umm, cashiers are NOT nice, I retract!  Zero stars for you, Kmart.

Perfect place for a quintessential Santa Barbara meal!  The location of this restaurant is right on the pier.  I wish the view was a bit better out the windows.  I would have sat outside but it was pretty cold that day.  We went around 2pm, so the wait was only about 10-15 minutes.  And we were able to watch the chef butcher and steam some massive crabs while we waited, quite entertaining!

We went with the coveted clam chowder and the cioppino in a bread bowl, along with some beers.  The ideal Santa Barbara meal!  Service was great, and food was quality.  A great place to bring a (small) group of visitors who want the Santa Barbara seafood experience, without the super high price tags.

Almost as visually pleasing and relaxing as the beach.  The architecture is just beautiful, parking is easy, and the view is breathtaking.  I'd like to take advantage of the thick patches of grass for some reading pleasure or a picnic.  And I'm going to bring any guest that comes to Santa Barbara to the clock tower view.  Ahhh, bliss.

Went today for the opening and was very pleased!  They advertised a noon opening, hyping it up by passing out flyers downtown last weekend.  They said there would be freebies for the first 250 customers.  I didn't really want to wait in a long line for a clothing store that I could find on weekend trips to LA, but when I was downtown today and the line to get in the store wasn't long, I decided to give it a shot.  They were giving everybody $10 off coupons for $50 purchases.

I expected the worse as I entered the store... I thought it'd be a mess.  But it was one of the best organized, cleanest, neatest H&M's I've visited... and there were SOO many people!  So that shows that this staff has it down from the beginning.  Very impressed.  The space is pretty big, and there are a lot of clean dressing rooms.  Yay for H&M finally coming to Santa Barbara!

Uhhh seriously?  I'm shocked at the high reviews.  I will flat out say from the get-go... we are Yogurtland fanatics, so all yogurt places are held up to the Yogurtland standard.

-The price: relatively expensive compared to Yogurtland (Yogurtland is 30 cents an ounce, this place is 38 cents an ounce).

-The yogurt: not firm at all, didn't have the right tart flavor... totally was melting at a faster rate than normal.

-The toppings: meh.  Nothing special.  The fruit was not particularly fresh, and the dry toppings were similar to most joints.

-The service: fine.  Nothing extraordinarily good or bad.

Two stars, because why go here when we could go to Yogurtland?  It's even worth the drive.  Won't be returning, not worth the money.

I thought about giving this place 3 stars... just because it's so expensive!  Almost $5 for a smoothie I think is kind of ridiculous.  I can make similar-tasting ones at home.  But I do admit that all of their smoothies are pretty delicious.  I feel like their trick is their orange juice.  Get smoothies with orange juice - they have a wonderfully tangy, sweet flavor.  The fruit is fresh, and the staff is usually pretty friendly.  When Casey and I bought a smoothie to share this weekend, they offered to put it in two cups, which was nice.  I would go here more if a) it wasn't so expensive, and b) smoothies weren't so high in calories.

We went here this past weekend, since I've been living in Santa Barbara now for about 2.5 years, and we still haven't visited this iconic landmark.  The self-guided tour is $5 each.  It'll take you about 20-30 minutes to go through the tour.  There is also a fountain/lawn/garden area in front that would be a great place to have a picnic.  The mission was really crowded on Saturday, maybe because of Easter weekend.  It's not that big.  Lots of free parking.  A must if you live in Santa Barbara, and a good place to go if you're visiting and enjoy history and landmarks.

The combination of the wonderful smoky smell that always comes from this place + the awesome low-budget commercials made us expect more (seriously, how can you not love those commercials?).

We got a combo plate to go to try at home.  The interior is very nice, plenty of seating, and service was super speedy.

We got home, and opened the styrofoam box, revealing 5 small pieces of tri-tip, two pieces of chicken, 4 corn tortillas, and small cups of rice and beans.  The tri-tip was overcooked.  These guys got nothing on Cold Spring Tavern.  The chicken was delicious - tender and flavorful.  The beans were a little "al dente" as Casey described, but I thought they were good.  And the rice was okay.

Overall, not very memorable.  We probably won't be returning (if we did, we'd just get the chicken).  So unlike the commercial which claims "it IS the best!".... not so much :-(  We wanted to like it more!

One of the best places to visit in Santa Barbara.  Great for all ages, and anybody that appreciates nature, animals, or the beauty of butterflies!  Yes, that sounded corny... but you will not regret it!  You can easily walk to the beach and have a picnic before or after.  Sometimes there are park rangers there with binoculars and information to share, but you can bring binoculars just in case.  Cameras and pictures do not capture the beauty of this place, so definitely go and see it for yourself.  I believe the best time of year to go is late January/February?  I've gone every year at this time since I moved to Santa Barbara four years ago, and I'm amazed every time!

FINALLY got around to trying this gem of a hole-in-the-wall!  After living in Santa Barbara for three years, we thought it was about time to try the coveted "Julia Child's favorite Mexican restaurant."  We went for the #2 (steak tacos), #16 (the special with marinated pork, cheese, and grilled peppers), and #18? (guacamole and two tortillas).  We loaded up on the fresh salsas and eagerly awaited our order.  There was plenty of seating (specifically, lawn furniture) in the semi-covered patio.  We were there at around 4:00, so it wasn't too busy.

When we got our food, we couldn't wait to dig in.  The #16 is definitely not overrated.  SO tasty.  LOVED the peppers.  Would definitely order it again.  The homemade tortillas and the guacamole were certainly tasty.  I loved that we could literally watch our tortillas being made from scratch as we waited in line.  The steak was pretty good in the steak tacos, but we'd probably try something different next time.  The salsas made everything taste better.  And we got a generous-sized cup of water, which is a lot better than those mini cups that most places give you, to make you feel bad for not buying a beverage.

The whole meal for me and my boyfriend was $13 - quite the deal!   And the cashier was friendly, and they bussed the tables in a timely manner.  This place is definitely worth trying.

I've been here once for a dinner, a couple times for happy hour, and one attempted happy hour.

I probably wouldn't recommend this place for dinner.  The prices are just too high.  I did have a fabulous Cioppino (I wish there was more broth though, that's the best part!) and the waiter was super attentive.  We had ordered the red clam chowder, but he accidentally poured the white, so he brought both over for us to try.  Very nice!  I'd recommend it for lunch, because it looks like they have similar offerings, but for much cheaper.

The first time I tried to come for happy hour, it was towards the middle of their happy hour on a Friday, so it was impossible to find space.  Other times, I've been poured a good glass of wine, but that's all I've really tried.  I'd like to try their happy hour appetizers, but I have to plan to get there right at the beginning of their happy hour... and that requires too much thinking and planning for a happy hour!

I really like the layout of this Starbucks.  There is a variety of seating choices (long wooden benched tables, small armchairs, and standard tables, with outdoor seating as well), with plenty of electric sockets for laptop use.  And being that this Starbucks isn't the biggest, I think they use the space nicely.  My drinks have always been made just fine here, and the baristas are friendly.  Parking is pretty easy, so what more could you ask for?  A great location to stop at after a morning workout at Spectrum!

Well organized, very large.  Usually stocked pretty well.

The cashiers are usually very friendly, but the staff in the aisles are slightly reluctant to help.  Also, the lines are always long!  And they usually only have one or two cashiers.

I think their prices are slightly high.  I'd rather stop at Target on my every-other-weekend trek to LA.

Fun little place, when you're looking for a refreshing alternative to the standard Starbucks.  It was around Halloween when we visited, so we had a coconut decaf coffee and a pumpkin chai latte.  Nothing amazing, nothing awful.  The coffee was a little bitter... you serve it to yourself, and since it was a later hour, it was likely sitting there a little too long.  But the ambiance is nice and calm.

Ok, so after Casey and I finished our meal here at lunch today, we decided that it deserved a 4.5.  We ordered six tacos: beef, marinated pork, steamed beef, tongue and cheek.  The service was great - friendly and attentive.  The place is a hole-in-the-wall, so don't expect neat and clean tables.  But the tacos were pretty darn delicious.  The tongue and marinated pork were my favorites.  Casey and I made each taco into two tacos, so we were each able to try, by using the two tortillas on each taco and dividing the contents among the two.  

BUT the reason why I'm now giving Lilly's Tacos a 3 (more like a 3.45) is because now, seven hours later, ten aggressive hand washes, two tries with hand sanitizer, and scrubbing my hands in a bowl of lemon and water... I CAN'T GET THE DAMN TACO SMELL OFF OF MY HANDS!  And it has progressively made me feel sicker and sicker as the days goes on.  So my memories of the tacos aren't as positive as they were earlier today.. because I have this lingering smell, not in a good way, on my hands that I can't get off!  Advice anyone?

Maybe I'll go back... but I guess I'll need to wear latex gloves or just use a fork and knife.

I have been to this cafe twice in the past couple of weeks for weekend brunch.  I love my eggs and omelets in the morning, and this cafe has some of the best omelets I've ever tasted!  I've tried the Spanish omelet and the Greek Italian.  Both were fabulous!  The Spanish omelet is FULL of so many types of veggies, cheddar, and a generous topping of red, thick salsa (not too spicy) and guacamole.  The Greek Italian was also delicious, but I actually preferred the Spanish.  

I tried a bite of my boyfriend's hash browns which were crispy and delicious.  Yum.  The omelets come with a type of potato side AND a bread side (toast, biscuit, etc.).  I paid the extra couple of bucks to replace the potato side with fruit.  Warning: the toast comes with SO much butter, so the second time I ordered it on the side.  

The service is good, coffee and water was consistently refilled.  And on my second visit they had coffee and mugs on a table outside of the restaurant to enjoy while you wait!  What a great idea!

This place is great for groups, as well as visitors. The surf theme is fun.  And the food is delicious.

Our experience was lackluster to say the least. The waitress got the wrong orders and repeatedly ignore our request to change it. she kept asking, "do you want more coke?" when she passes by. 

looking at other table getting the food they ordered, and savoying each bite as they chow down those juicy meat, kept us wondering: "what if we got what we wanted to eat?"

yes, this is a rustic tavern, enough said.
Best followup in this space so far. Unlike their predecessors, they seem to "get it" in many ways. A great addition to the scene on 10th and for Cummins Station.

Meh? These guys have a great location and a lot of potential but I was totally not impressed today. I ordered the orange chicken which was very chewy and dry. It came on broccoli which was barely steamed and cold. All the tables were sticky, and my tray was served with a previously used paper menu sheet, which might've just been beat up because he was placed on a wet tray. I didn't feel like there were any health problems in the place but it definitely doesn't stand up very well when you have superior options, both independently owned and nationally owned.

Holy HELL, the disorganized dumbfuckery here... It would be one thing if they were even remotely busy, or if it were just something like a language barrier but in general they seem to have an overall flawed process and trouble paying attention to what's going on. Having soy sauce locked up like Ft. Knox and then shoving a fist full at me wastefully makes no sense and just shows off the poor planning and lack of thinking involved.
Tasty fare and a nice addition to the Nashville food landscape. Awkward location to drive to. Try to do a rideshare or walk up.
Nice spot, and very well-located for all types of visitors, from daytime office traffic to the many residents of the Gulch. Nice to see them come to Nashville.

Phenomenal spot. Feels like a secret hideaway, loaded with history, excellent reuse of an old space. Good cocktail menu. Variety of party size accommodations. It can be crowded at times and a little hipster-dominated, but always a nice time.

Incredibly sexy spot for a date. If she's not impressed by this place, you call her a ride and lose her number. The mood and vibe are an ideal precursor for that "go back to my place" or "let's get a room" stage of the evening.

Good sound system and usually a good DJ working. It can get loud and the staff can be a little overrun, but a little confidence and good tipping goes a long way.

There are a few knowledgeable Nashville go-to locations for all manner of booze, and one of the best is Midtown. Large selection and good staff. Plenty of options for helpful attention to custom orders and such as well. Reasonable pricing and convenient location, with decent parking.

Retail haircuts are what they are, but if you ask for Tony here, you'll get someone who is leaps and bounds beyond the workplace he's operating in. Convenient location, fair prices, but beware some of the old, crusty employees who transferred in from Belle Meade when the two locations combined. One of the gals' bat-wing-flab will waft her ashtray-scent at you the whole time and you don't want that.

This is one of our staple neighborhood bars. The entire ML Rose "chain" is great on food and beer options, and the staff is great at almost any location, but this one (and Capitol View) tend to have the best crew. They have decent parking and they're convenient to a drive up or walking in. Their recent remodel really opened the place up nicely, expanding their outdoor gardens as well.

However, they added a really stupid mini-golf element and have lifted the ban on kids they used to have after 5pm. This was an unwelcome and inexplicable kowtow to the young families gentrifying the neighborhoods around them and the golf flag spikes are an insane liability to add to the drinking environment, to say nothing of golf clubs. Even so, this is a go-to for great food and drink from a genuine local spot.

Their name is a little dumb, and has a somewhat sloppy legal history, as they gave in way too easily to idle threats from a pool hall near their original location. They were "Melrose Craft Beer & Burgers" and when challenged, they backed down and chose the somewhat goofy "ML Rose" knockoff. Nonetheless, they are a key figure in the Nashville landscape of restaurants and bars and should become part of your regularity in places to hang.

Mike's is a staple and legend of the main drag in Nashville. They used to be on Broadway, but have expanded quite nicely over on 2nd. Great selection of ice cream and a must-stop for a visit downtown.

We had a very pleasant buying experience at this dealer on a beautiful and very busy Saturday. Pete Purky took all of the necessary time to help us with the final stages of a decision that we had been considering for weeks. Despite some of the normal trappings of a conglomerate corporate car dealer outlet, such as the attempt to nickel and dime you in the finance department, we came away with a positive impression of a dealer for which natives to the Nashville area carry decades of history and exposure to. The deal made was a bit more competitive than other area dealers and the correct vehicle options were in stock. Not having to test drive with the salesperson in the car was another big bonus to this experience, as the ride along is moldy and outdated and unnecessary in the modern age of tracking and technology. We were able to have an honest discussion between the two of us while we drove and truly check the car out in our own ways without a continued sales pitch from the backseat. Also, the final paperwork on the digital table was pretty rad.

Mike's is a staple and legend of the main drag in Nashville. They used to be on Broadway, but have expanded quite nicely over on 2nd. Great selection of ice cream and a must-stop for a visit downtown!

Recently, they bested the trendy "new Nashville" scene big time:

We decided not to invest time in a massive line at a half-empty Legendairy Milkshake Bar, so we opted to pop around the corner to the Nashvegas ice cream O.G. - Mikes. Violet worked her magic after I challenged her to show them up. It was delicious, and I've even named it for them: The Mug, the Myth, the LEGEND. (See what I did there?)
This location is a convenient alternative to the more crowded one a little further down, sans drive-thru.

A little bit painfully slow and seemingly disorganized and understaffed. Great variety, though. Nice addition to The Gulch, and part of the very vibrant craft beer scene in Nashville now. Small place and gets cramped. Parking is not plentiful. Better in warm weather when crowd can disperse.

Great spot, with ACTUAL coffee shop hours, unlike quite a few Nashville cafes. (You know who you are.)

Also -jam- packed with beautiful Belmont ladies.

Cool theme, nice vibe, great place!

An absolutely essential part of the Nashville culinary experience. Wonderful success story as well. They've nicely remodeled and expanded too. Here's hoping they're able to weather the economy as it stands during COVID. All hail Arnold's!

This place is an overpriced ripoff. They use the name "Miles" to fool you into thinking they are high end and nicer like their other locations, when it's just a glorified drive-thru wash you can get anywhere else for an average of $5 less. They don't even have any sort of vacuuming. Waste of money and time.

TPAC is the bearer of a legacy for the greatest performances in the greatest variety in Nashville. They preside over phenomenal venues that have literally held up proudly through time. You'll see a variety of fare tour to their halls - from standup to broadway to music to ballet... they've got it all throughout the year. Good partner for events as well, and their educational initiatives are vital to the arts landscape of Nashville. Fabulous entity for your private or corporate support dollars as well.

We recently had visits from two fellas for two different issues our property management folks hired Nashville Handyman for. Warren came out to clean gutters, and cheerfully made a second visit when our landlord's poor description of the work cause him to need a ladder for the back. He was just the middle man and handled the situation like a champ. Work was done the same week and well.

Malcolm also recently visited to do a couple of door knob replacements. Quick, knew exactly what he was doing. Friendly dude, too!

Warren is younger and more "hipster" cool and Malcom is a older than me (but not "old!") and clearly knows what's up. Both were good examples for their peers and pleasant to work with, showing a nice spectrum of team members involved.

Also, the text communications from Cindy were handy and helpful, with timely replies handling our needs spot-on.

Neat place. Shame they lost their old building to developers with no respect for history, but the new location is very convenient. They can almost fix anything and they do good work. They gave a favorite pair of my shoes a new lease on life.

This place has a storied history that is well worth your reading of the menu or a trip down the Google rabbit hole. I won't dig into all that here, but you should.

Incredibly cool spot with a great menu of food (the scallops - OMG) and excellent cocktails. They feature live entertainment and burlesque, and on some nights they can be a little crowded, with the occasional attempt to charge a cover (which is asking a little much given the costs of the menu items).

There isn't a bad seat in the house, but the front dining area along the catwalk for the girls is one of the best if you're not just hanging at the bar. Their staff is quick and professional and their managing partner, David, is one of the finest and most consummate hosts in town.
Lovely park with some interesting history. Wonderful greenway, excellent connectivity to the neighborhood, nice community center, etc.

These guys are the poster-child for the era of lazy, "turn-key" property management franchise garbage. Specifically, the local staff for this one tends to approach all renters like children and their lease contracts will make attempts to slip in all manner of petty, nickel-and-dime bullcrap, including various attempts to railroad you into services that are not allowed to be forced upon you by state/federal regulations. Be wary.

Tasty food, great concept. Noble idea among the glut of burger joints in Nashville. It's also nice that they have good specials from time to time and excellent milkshakes. Very convenient location as well, for residents, business, and destination traffic. Nice big tables for groups, and just as good as a to-go order on the food as well.

A Nashville staple! Check the hours and open/closed seasons, if you're making a special trip. Is it an old-school no-frills ice cream joint with outdoor seating, but a very fun throwback and community attraction.

Excellent spot to cool down after a Hot Chicken bender next door at Hattie B's.

While on a very thorough and weeks-long journey of consideration for a new or used car, we visited Gallatin Honda for some test-drives. The very professional and calm, zen-like vibe and helpful factual focus of Richard Rocha was a very nice experience. We chose another dealer based on a price/availability factor, but would have just as well have purchased from Richard and Gallatin had very few factors been different. They should certainly be on your list when shopping Hondas!

Nashville has a handful of fabulous local coffee shops. This one is newer on the scene than others, but catapulted right to the top of the heap. Great coffee, and a true immersing in the culture and craft of all varieties of coffee by the owner and staff. Great people work here.

Good food, but a tad limited. They also used to have turkey alternatives which they dropped. Pastry options are always awesome, though. Also the Breakfast Burrito is a great option.

It's not their fault per se, but the parking is horrid and the entrance and exit is on a stretch of Charlotte that the city and state are evidently going to drag their feet about till someone gets killed. It is a site of multiple car accidents so far with no sign of improvement, so please be careful!

Real Nashville original, with a truly unique concept, but a lot of compromises in service quality, comfort, and menu. Their beer selection has evolved over the years from laughably tiny to moderate, but they're still hanging far behind for a Nashville spot. They did a remodel out back that's quite nice, but management has a tendency to neglect things, so don't count on it all remaining nice. Out front is a cool garden space and fire pit that's nice on the right days as well.

Parking is horrific. When it is not a total clusterfuck, the potholes in the gravel lot will eat your car if it's anything shy of a Hummer. Uber or Lyft to this one.

Staff can be hit or miss on efficiency and you have to be a regular to truly get a decent priority.

The place is usually loaded with sexy female clientele but can also be polluted by the occasional bro-fest, however most of those herds trend toward other lesser-quality haunts nearby.
Thistle Stop Cafe is so wonderful. One visit and I'm hooked! These are cheerful ladies! I've been smiling and laughing since I was greeted. Neat place with great fare, and good for the ol' spirit.

(Not sure why this review keeps getting flagged and deleted by Yelp, but I'm going to start deducting stars from it now that I suspect either the owner or someone at Yelp responding to a malicious person (Zot, probably) abusively reporting my posts for no reason....)

Unremarkable. Disorganized. Slow.

They seem like nice wait staff and the food is ok, but they're all in each other's business and seem very rough around the edges. The exterior is completely unnoticeable. They seem to be rushing the lunch crowd out a bit much. Just not terribly impressed, and with very affordable Italian in a much more professional and inspired atmosphere, with more variety nearby, this seems like a miss.

(Removed reference to a competitor, so WHAT YOU GOT NOW?)

Welcome to Nashvegas, y'all! Our airport has made many great strides over the decades, and we love that it connects our "it city" to the world. If you visit, however, please just make a mental note of all those "Nashville original" spots you see pimping their food and drink to you, and wait till you're actually in the city to check out the true original spots.

It's hard to get a unique concept on a pizzeria. They've done it, though, and despite being pretty crowded with almost no parking to speak of, they're a fabulous spot for all purposes: date night, single pickup, family dining, solo at the bar... whatever. Great food, great staff, excellent beer menu, etc. Nice spaces for a variety of setups and parties.

I will always be perturbed, though, that they cut the Vinnie Mac from their menu. (Fried Mac and cheese bocks with a vodka sauce for dipping.) It was TO DIE (or get whacked) FOR.

Easily a must on the growing list of Nashville Hot Chicken spots, as the fare makes its continued wave of popularity felt. They have a very different and unique spin on the concept. They'll never tell you what's in their blend of spice, but there is an Indian flair to it. Perhaps cumin or turmeric or both.

The real top-off is their full-blown-fat-kid invention of deep-frying a grilled cheese with pepperjack, via the same badder and method as the chicken. Their menu is pretty much entirely horrible for your health, but oh-so-damned-great. Do the Apple Jack (that fried sammich with hot apples) and turn it into a mild religious experience.

One big downer - their staff has a lot to learn about beer in a town that's really married to brewery and craft beer culture. They don't know much about their taps at any given time.

When people bitch and moan about property taxes, take them here and show them what a wonderful resource it is. This is one of many very nice Metro CCs with great amenities and a staff who seems to really care about doing the work they do. Lovely spot, central to the rebound of the Sylvan Park community.

Nice place. Good doc. She's brilliant and her lovely daughter is coming along in the family business as well. Location is convenient but also on-trend for "new Nashville."

We love our usual hygienist, but she balked at the idea of us possibly exploring Smile Direct for our son's needs. They need to evolve and defend the talking points of traditional greedy orthodontics a little less. Otherwise, we could not be happier for adults and kids' care.

These folks are the keepers of the legacy of Country Music for all time. Beautiful space, lovely exhibits, dedicated staff, phenomenal event spaces... it's all top-notch. A bit pricey on many fronts, though.

Ok, I'm in St. Louis on a business trip, what to do for dinner? Hooters?  Nah, not really interested in wings and orange short-shorts.  How about some ribs?  I stumbled on Masterpiece and got pulled in by the smells, who can resist ribs?  Order at the counter and grab a table, within 10 minutes I'm greeted with a large slab of ribs over white bread along with a side of cheese bread and baked beans.  

Overall Masterpiece made some good ribs but not great.  A bit drier than I expected, I'm guessing they were sitting outside for a while.  Sides were ok but nothing to write home about, nothing particularly fresh.  I do enjoy my KC Masterpiece BBQ sauce at home but can't really say that you've got to try the place when visiting St. Louis.  There are probably better and more authentic rib joints in the city.  But I have to admit, the Gateway Arch on the walk back to the hotel was VERY cool....

While drive from NYC to NC, I planned on dropping in for my first real Philly cheesesteak and picked John's given its reputation and location off of I-95. This little foodie mecca had about a 25 minute wait at 2pm but wait I did. 

While the lines can get long, they have an efficient operation here. If you wanted anything but a cheesesteak (roast pork, meatball, etc) you were fast-tracked up front. But I grabbed a fresh cheesesteak and roast pork sandwich for my ride back home. And wow, so good! Lovely sesame seeded roll, about 11" long, stuffed with flavorful steak, provolone and onions. Loved the sliced roast pork that's simmered in a wine broth and spiked with sharp provolone. You can get it with spinach (not broccoli di rabe) at John's. 

I devoured half of my two sandwiches (they are big) on my 8 hour ride and then finished them off for lunch the next day. So simple but so good! Hope to get back up here, some day...

Gosh, there was a time when I loved Chili's chicken crispers but it's been years.  A group from work stopped in at this Chili's for a quick dinner and let's just say it was a reminder of why I haven't been to one in ages.  The appetizers were ok but nothing interesting, ribs were lacking meat and the margarita was a bit weak. Add in a less than clean interior, average service and I'm not sure why people eat at chain restaurants like Chili's.  

There are so many better places and ways to spend your money even if the commercials may be catchy.  I'm guessing I won't be baby-back, baby-back in a Chili's again for at least another couple of years.  Underwhelming food and dining experience, end of story...

This huge outdoor mall was a great find while on a brief getaway to Reno. I giddily shopped Pottery Barn, Orvis, and Dillard's and was majorly surprised by how nice all the employees were (hey, I'm from California)..Nor did any of the employees' demeanors change when we stepped out of stores without any purchases. It was nice to leisurely walk and shop, but some places are driving distance away, since it is just a large strip of shops. Also, missing were small food shops while the actual restaurants were stand-alones not connected to the strip. Still, if back in this area, I would definitely come back. The Dillard's here was a tad nicer than the Macy's west chains, and had pretty sweet deals.

"Yum, yum, yum," said my tummy when all kinds of delicious goodness was devoured by myself. This buffet is awesome!! Unlike others, it is situated in the middle of the game floor, with a crazy, cool Atlantis decor and intimate seating. I really, really like the ambiance here. The attendants are attentive, and the old Keno lady was cool too. I guess the whole casino was recently remodeled, so there isn't much of a smoke smell anywhere at all.
Now, the food itself was high quality and fresh. The strawberries were flawless, the mini mousse cups were delicious, and main dishes pretty decent. Note though, if going in around closing time, the hot foods aren't really that fresh.
Conclusion: food was good especially since the lunch price in the middle of the week was so cheap. Sadface, king crab legs are only served on weekend dinners.

This is your run of the mill crap Simon mall that you'll find in obscure neighborhoods. I was more than disappointed with the shopping options here while on a brief trip to Reno. The only decent stores are Victoria's Secret and Express, which you can easily find at any Westgate. Even the Macy's anchor store had only meager offerings.
We ended up asking an employee for directions to The Summit outdoor shopping area, which was 10x better. Don't waste your time here.
Plus: encountered shop employees were all friendly and helpful.
Minus: exudes a ghetto feel. Think Eastridge of San Jose.

Are you kidding me? $45 for a mediocre spa pedicure?? No offense to the technician, but this place rather blows. First off, an employee told me on the down low that the receptionists are incompetent--after all, they're just barely in high school looking to make a quick buck. They always mess up with the schedule, and have no idea how to run a front desk. Secondly, the actual pedicure itself resulted in a messy paint job and aweird not-smooth texture on my big toes. I've easily had better pedicures for less than half the price. And third, it was also mentioned that the employees (masseuses and hair stylists) barely have any experience.
On the flipside, the spa part of the pedicure was quite relaxing. They use high quality products here, and each client gets his/her full hour of pampering. The Atlantis pedicure included a dip in the foot bath, a salt scrub, a mud mask with hot towel, and a whatever massage. That, and you are offered free of charge juice, water, soda, or even champagne...I mean, if the high school employee person remembers to ask you.
Ehh, it was a nice way to spend my time while the male was downstairs somewhere gambling away, but this is definitely not a place to designate as your main pampering location.

In days of yore, I recall running amok with cousins on the game floor, cash in hand, and with cheap-o stuffed animal winnings in a giant clear, plastic garbage bag. It was fun, and apparently was THE place to dump kids while adults gambled downstairs or at the neighboring attached casinos. 
Fast forward to now, like fifteen years later, and this place is EXACTLY the same, minus all the fun and excitement...also meaning it is freaking old and falling apart. The games are all the same and the midway is still there. Your best bet is still the balloon dart game and it is still very possible to win with the claw games. 
Maybe with a kid's perspective this place is still fun, but as an adult, I've now no desire to come back to this place.

We have gone on several Carnival cruises from the port here. We always had a good a time and met nice folks. The food is decent, not great. The entertainment is good. The rooms are small, but you do not spend much time in the room. The cabin staff was great, as was all the service.The opportunities for fun are totally unlimited in port or on the ship. We have now tried some other lines and some of them have nicer amenities, but we had a lot of fun on Carnival.

Kelley's is a good solid place to eat. The breakfast/brunch menu is outstanding. I like the dinner menu as well. I also like coming to the bar in the evenings. They have a great location and have been doing a great job for many years.
The place to go to get a great deal on a custom built aluminum trailer. They built 3 or 4 for me over the years. All functioned perfectly and they will maintain it for you also.

THE  place to stay to get a balcony overlooking bourbon street and party all the time. It's all happening below you and right outside your door. If you like to get some sleep, better go somewhere else, it is non stop on bourbon street every weekend.

I love Trader Joes. It is my favorite grocery store ever. They manage to combine great quality, service and selection with low prices. Some of my favorites here are the coffee, wines, and snacks. They have some of the best trail mixes you will find anywhere.

This is the coolest book store I have ever experienced. It is not the most upscale, but it is big, full of all kinds of books on every topic you can think of. You can literally spend an afternoon browsing around inside, I have on several occasions.. They sell new and used books. This store is locally owned and operated, and has been here for many years. A friend turned me on to it about 20 years ago, and I have been a fan since then.

A really good restaurant at the tourist district. They have all the traditional Greek foods, all very well done. They have been here for many years and know what they are doing. The pastries are some of the best in town.

A nice locals place in IRB for seafood. I have been coming here for years. Nothing has changed much. They continue to do a pretty good job on simply prepared seafood. We usually have a good time here and leave satisfied.

This is quite a nice place to hang out. I like the bar up front and the patio in the back. The mixed drinks are very good. My only gripe is it gets so loud on the back patio that it is hard to hear people talk.

I think this was one of the first Japanese retaurants in Pinellas county. It used to be THE place to go back in the day. They always serve consistently good, if not great food. It is always a fun place to go. The 3 sided sushi bar lets you strike up conversations with other diners easily. The staff are awesome, especially the sushi chefs.

A cool place with history, character and personality. They have been here a long time, but nothing has changed much. Get some fish spread and some smoked fish. They know what they are doing with these items. Sit on the picnic tables and wash it down with a cold drink, as people have been doing here for 50 years.
The roast pork was excellent, the baked chicken was a little lacking in flavor. The portions are huge and the folks that serve you are very nice.

This is a pretty nice club, and one of the very few places you can go around here at night. You can dance and have a good time. The crowd is really young and can be quite rowdy, so be prepared for that.

The Tiki bar is the place to see and be seen at Clearwater beach on Sundays. It has been wlidly popular for many years. People come by car and boat to be here. It is a young crowd of hard partiers, so be prepared. The restaurant inside is just so so in my opinions. The nightclub can be fun, but my favorite part is the outside by the beach when the bands are playing.

We think Muriel's is absolutely fabulous. From the moment we were greeted everything was flawless. We loved the appointments in the dining room. The seafood gumbo was delicious. I had the stuffed mirliton. Now the mirliton does not have a bold flavor on it's own, but when filled with a seafood stuffing, and served over a creole roasted tomato sauce, it was a flavor bomb. Our service was impeccable, and the lunch menu price made it an outstanding value.
Skyline is a unique twist on chili, and I enjoy it. My favorite is the 4 way. The Burritos look interesting also. I think this is a big improvement on the normal fast food fare available nearby.

The park is nice and very well maintained. They have a nice dog play area, and an onsite restaurant and event center. The location is convenient to town and to Lazy Days, if you are having any work done. There is a Camping World store nearby as well. The part of town it is in is not the best, but we always felt completely safe here.

This is a nice Home Depot. I really like how they layout their stores in the same way, so you can find things easily in any store you go to. I needed a specialized plumbing part on my recent trip. When I arrived in the plumbing department, an associate quickly showed me just what I needed. I picked up the other things I was looking for, and was on my way in a few minutes time. Great customer service.
They make some nice burgers here and I do enjoy them. The massive size and the bottomless fries can cause you to overeat and leave feeling stuffed. I would only dine here infrequently.
They saw our kitty and took good care of him. We have been using them for boarding, but this was our first visit to a vet. We were happy with our visit here.
These guys are simply great. My bike rides so much nicer now that they tuned it up. They adjusted the fit on my wife's bike. Prices on gear are very good here as well. Check this place out.

Nice hangout at John's Pass village. They have good food and do a booming bar business. You can come by land or sea, they have a dock and dock master to moor boats. The place picks up at night, this is a very popular night spot. It has a great view of the waterway, and there is usually a breeze to cool you off.

Very cool small park in the CBD. It is a great venue for events. The big trees make this place very relaxing and the shade cools things off when it is hot outside. A good place to sit and eat or just relax.

We stopped here after the Bucs game for a bite before heading home. I hadn't eaten at a Moe's in quite some time, maybe 5 years. I think it has gotten better. I had the chicken rice bowl and it was quite good. The chicken had been freshly grilled and the rice was very tasty. They top it with your choice of ingredients. The highlight was the salsa bar, which had about 6 different choices. I tried several and they added some major flavor to my meal.

In addition to the great bar and service, the food is awesome here. I had a roast beef sandwich which was flat out delicious. My partner had a BLT and loved it. We came here because they serve food late, but come in anytime for a great sandwich.

This is a very nice pool bar and restaurant at IRB. the food was way better than expected, and its a great place to watch the boats cruising down the waterway. The pool is nice and crowded every weekend. You can come by car or boat.
I like this Home Depot. It was my go to store when I lived in town. It is in a very convenient location of Clearwater. The customer service has always been very good here.

The desert is quite beautiful here I the Tucson area. You have to careful where you step to avoid having an encounter with a cactus. You really want to look but not touch anything here. We did not see much wildlife, but walking among the desert plant life is quite an experience.

Absolutely fabulous place for hiking. A real memorable experience hiking in the Bear Canyon. There are trails for all level hikers in this National Forest area. This place is popular, the lot fills up quickly. If you arrive mid morning, you will probably have to wait for someone to leave to get a spot.

Great place for bluegrass and hillbilly music. The bands we saw were very talented. The servers are friendly and accommodating here. The crowd is a bit more laid back than some of the rowdier places in town.

After having been here a number of times and frequenting the casino, bars, restaurants and the club, i rate this place as a 2 star, bush league place. The staff can be extremely unfriendly at times for no apparent good reason. It does not live up to what you expect from a Hard Rock establishment.

I will rate the surrounding areas a 5. This is some of the best of the best of the desert. The city itself is a 2. The place has so much potential, and you can find small gem areas in town, but for the most part, it is a let down. We were here for a few weeks and tried hard to find things we liked. We found some, but actually found may more things we didn't like here.

I love the trail. You can trek just about all of Pinellas county here. It is more congested going through Clearwater, and more open north and south. There are plenty of places to pull over and get food and drinks along the way. I have had fun riding my bike and roller blading here..

This place was so great. We arrived early and got seated with no wait. Drinks were served quickly, and our service was wonderful throughout. Every small dish we tried was a taste sensation, bruschetta first. It had a unique twist on this classic Italian dish. Next up was the Tempura shrimp, barely battered and sauced with some Japanese mayo and Asian mustard, so delicious I do not have words for it. Fish tacos, small and delightful flavor. Last up, the lamb sliders, so good. One of the best burger type items I have tasted.

Winghouse is always a fun stop. I have been frequenting this location for many years and it has been consistently good. I like the extra crispy naked wings best and they are quite good here. Service is always good and the crowd is usually lively. They have done really well and have many locations now so the concept must work well.

Ybor City is a small gem of the Tampa area. Developed by immigrants many years ago 7th Avenue has a cool vibe, that is a bit reminiscent of New Orleans. Most of the things of interest are clustered on or around 7th Avenue. This used to be the world's center for Cigar rolling for many years, and the large factories are sprinkled around. Lots of restaurants, shops and bars line the streets, great place to visit.

We had a very nice stay here. Sites are unusual for an RV park. Ours had a large space, much bigger than you would expect. Ours had a nice yard in front and was shaded by large Oak trees. Everything worked well at the site. Wi Fi worked but was a bit intermittent. The whole place was very well maintained. The location was convenient to everything in the area.

We enjoyed their salads and Pizza here very much. A salad and Pizza is plenty for 2 people so the pricing is great. The Pizzas are freshly cooked in the brick oven, and very tasty. The butter pecan salad is excellent.
This is a very nice Winn Dixie store. It is large and well stocked. Very neat and clean inside. The employees are very pleasant also. This store is much nicer than the ones near my home in Orlando.
I haven't been here in a few years. In that time this place has gotten even better. One of the best in the area with no doubt. Food is superb, as is the service. You can't go wrong here.

After walking by this cute place a few times, I finally had a chance to stop in. The space is inviting, and usually pretty busy. They made me a very nice latte, and the menu of drinks looks very good. This place is open late, which is a plus.
We stopped in here recently to get subs. The service was lightning fast as usual and we were very happy with the sandwiches. It is easy to stop in here on the way to the beach.

All of Tucson is a gem show at the beginning of February. It is quite a site. You can get some good deals here as well. Some shows are wholesale only, this one was open to the public. Well worth checking out.

Sandwiches are good, and it always amazing to see how fast they serve you. This store gets very busy at lunch time, with lots of deliveries. The staff really hustles to make sure everyone gets good service. That was impressive.

This a fun place to hangout, day or night. It is especially nice on a nice beach day. You can have a drink and you are at the beautiful white sands of St. Pete beach. You can play some beach volleyball or just lounge around.
We love it here. Every time I pass through it makes me want to move here. Love the architecture and the plethora of things to do in this neighborhood.

This place is quite touristy, but the food was good, and reasonably priced. They have lots of game and wild animals on the menu, but I stayed somewhat conservative and got the barbeque ribs with a loaded baked potato. The meal was very good, the ribs were super tasty and fell right off the bone. Service was wonderful.

This place has been the go to Pizza place at Clearwater beach for decades. They don't make the best Pizza in my opinion, but they are always consistent and many people seem to love it. This is more Greek style Pizza, and I prefer a thinner crust.
A nice Super Target. It is impossible to come in here and not find things you want. Target carries some nice items for around the house, which is what we are usually after here.
This place is awesome. I have enjoyed dining here since my first visit many years ago. I have never had anything but excellent food and service at this establishment.

My dogs love it here at the small dog park. They allocated plenty of space for the little guys. We played with the frisbee and had plenty of room to run. Met some nice other small dogs to play with. It was great fun.
Love their pizza's and atmosphere. as do many others cause it is usually crowded.  A little oasis of real food in an area where it is hard to find.
3 stars because this is the original and it is an OK place to stop for a beer. The food is pretty mediocre in my opinion. I just never liked anything on the menu.
They have some great bands playing here. The place is nothing special, but the music acts are. This is a fun place on Bourbon street, and one we will return to.

This is a good place to see a show. The sound is usually very good here, as they do not have as many reflections as in an indoor venue. You have a good hike from the parking lot to get in, that is a small minus. Plenty of food and drink vendors once you get inside. I always look forward to shows here.
Very nice high end Scandinavian furniture. I have always liked this style and enjoyed shopping here.

Came here a few times lately and was happy with the coffee and breakfast sandwiches. I thought they operate like any typical Dunkin store. Then I saw all the super bad reviews here. I did not have any issues.

This is a decent place to watch a band. You can see and hear them quite well from the sidewalk so you can decide if you want to go in or not. There is no cover, but you have to buy a drink once you go in.

We are enjoying our first year as season ticket holders. Last years home game blackouts pushed me over the edge, I was dying to see more Bucs football. We are enjoying the stadium and look forward to a great season.

It is well worth seeking out this out of the way place, tucked in the back of a bar. The sandwiches are very good. They make some killer Po Boys that deviate a bit from the standard presentations, while remaining quite yummy.

This is a cool older building on Printers Alley. The exposed stone and wood inside gives it a nice vibe. We stopped in because we heard the food was good here. After perusing the lunch menu, we did not find anything we liked, so we just had a drink and left. They have burlesque shows at night here.

I have always enjoyed the Dunedin Brewery. They have a nice laid back crowd of regulars that create a sense of community. The beer selection is great, and it is very pleasant to spend some time here at any time of day. I used to stop in all the time when I lived in the area, and still drop by when I am back visiting.
I don't really care for Sonny's BBQ. The meats usually are dry and bland.

A nice local place to hang out, drink and eat. It is convenient to stop in when on the Pinellas trail, and they are dog friendly. The crowd is usually a mix of ages. You can watch or play games while here. I have always had a good time when visiting.
Great place to buy cigars and accessories. They also have a very nice lounge to relax and smoke a cigar inn. This store is worth a visit if you are in the area.

I have been here many times and always enjoyed. It is a place where locals hang out. I see many folks I know from Clearwater hanging out here. It is hard not to like a place like this. It is directly on Clearwater beach, with outstanding views. Parking is very convenient in the adjacent lot, as long as it is not filled to capacity. They are always open all day and night and usually have live music.
This a great place for fresh seafood and great water views. You can get things to go or eat in. All the food is fresh and tasty. The views of the marina are very nice and relaxing.

We really enjoy this place. They have a very nice attractive facility here. The venue is well laid out and nicely appointed. The sound system is good and they book some good bands. Drink prices are reasonable. They have a small menu of food available as well.

We had a nice time here. There are multiple levels and multiple themes. There was a band downstairs and DJ's up above. Lots of folks having a good time.They serve food here as well, sort of covers all bases, We liked it.

Great buffet of southern food. The fried chicken was excellent, as were the fresh vegtables and desserts. The price was very reasonable and the service was great as well. Adjacent to the Plant City farmers market.

A very nice music club. They usually charge a small cover and seem to have top bands here. The service is very good at the bars. The place is a bit larger than most in the area, and feels spacious inside. Thee walls are dark wood and have an interesting texture to them, maybe they improve the sound. We enjoyed it here.

A pretty cool neighborhood dive bar. This place has been around a long time. I first stopped in in the 80's. The atmosphere is very laid back.  It is a good place to hang out and enjoy a drink or two.

This is great place to stay if you want to spend a night or two checking out the club scene in Ybor City. You can walk to everything easily and the hotel is very nice. You are actually staying closer to everything than if you drive up and park your car in one of the public parking lots.

The Salt Rock Tavern has such a nice layout. I loved the decor and the TV's at the tables. The selection of beers and wines was extensive. We were here for a Sunday Brunch, and were truly impressed. The service was excellent, although we generally served ourselves from the ample varieties of food. They had anything you could want, omelettes, breads and cheeses, cooked foods, a raw seafood bar, it went on and on. Everything we tried was quite good. We really enjoyed the brunch here.

I really like Jackson's, more for the experience of it than the food. The place is great, it packs a huge crowd, and the food is OK. You can spend a good bit of time here working your way through the indoor and outdoor spaces.

The burgers and fries are absolutely great here. Service was awesome. The singer was too loud for the place and a bit annoying for trying to enjoy a meal. We wished we had a volume dial to turn him down a notch.

Shells is always a good choice for seafood. They have everything on the menu and are well known for their pasta dishes. The pricing is really reasonable compared to just about every one else. Survive is fast and efficient. They have been around the Tampa bay area for a long time and  really know what they are doing and do a great job at it.

We like this place very much and try to make it a point to stop here whenever we can. The food is consistently excellent and a great value for the price,. The selections change from trip to trip. We recently had some pot roast here that was out of this world, along with delicious mashed potatoes.
Nice locally owned tackle store. They have been around a long time and know the local fishing scene. If you need some gear they will hook you up. The have a great selection of custom rods here.

I give it 3 stars. It is hard to park here. It gets over crowded, and they could do most things better. The saving grace is the location, right on the beautiful beach serving food and alcohol. So that redeems the place. I have stopped here many times and will continue to come back.

They sell some  high quality seating here. The company specializes in seating and they are really skilled at producing great products. The prices are higher than some other places, but the products are of higher quality.

Fort De Soto Park is 1136 acres of awesomeness on 5 little islands. There are tons of outdoor activities to do here. You can camp at the beautiful campground. There are more than 200 sites, many of them with beautiful waterfront views. There are multiple beaches here, one for dogs to enjoy. It is also a nice place to ride a bike or hike. There is a huge boat ramp here for boaters, and plenty of spots to fish from bridges, piers and the shore. You can also rent canoes or kayaks and follow a marked course. There are plenty of facilities and snack bars spread throughout the park.

They have many activities here at the fairgrounds. The parking is ample and access is fairly easy. There is plenty of space here for indoor and outdoor events. I have been to home shows, RV shows and a few other events here. They are always fun.

I agree with the other reviews. Like others I have eaten here over many years. It has always seemed that they are just going through the motions, never trying to excel. The food service and ambiance is always average to mediocre. It could be done much better.

I have stayed here quite a few times over the years. it has a convenient location, but  the rooms can be small, and you do get quite a bit of noise from the riverboats. I still like it, the courtyard is charming and the staff are helpful. You can often find great online discount prices for rooms here.

Love the Cajun music here. The bar itself is like many on Bourbon Street, but the music sets it apart. They do try to be unique with the drinks, Shark Attack, Horny Gator, Hand grenade, etc. We had fun here.

Honky Tonkin on 3 levels. You can go up or down until you find some band you like. The place gets packed just about any night of the week. You will see some awesome musicians in here, the local bar bands in Nashville are the most talented I have ever seen.
I like it on the off hours the best. When the crowds are smaller, this place is more enjoyable. When they get busy it is pretty much wall to wall college kids. That can be fun also, but not my scene.
This is a top notch place. We like to stop here when passing by for a delicious ice cream concoction. In fact, it is hard to drive by without stopping.

This cafe has really good food, We tried 3 of the rice bowls and loved them all. The bar features a big selection of high end whiskey. At night they become a club with a DJ and dance music. The sidewalk tables are a great place to hang out.
Great place for Pizza and beer. The Capogna family are the best. A Clearwater landmark. The place has been here forever and it is still a great place to go for a casual dinner.
This is not a great theater. The screens are not very large, the sound is marginal, and the seating is poorly laid out. We came here for the convenience of it, but can't give it a very high rating.
I bought a watch here. The price was great, as was the service I received from the staff. They have been in business here for many years.

I thought this was an OK museum. I know virtually nothing about country music so it was educational to me. The history is all pretty recent, but it is well represented here. The facility was very impressive. The bang for the 25 buck admission a little less so.

I like going here, mostly for the location. It is a nice old converted house, and the outside patio is a great spot to have a bite to eat and watch every thing going on outside. The food can be a bit hit or miss, but is usually decent. If I was rating on food alone I would say 2 stars, but the overall experience is 3 stars.

This is a super place to do business with. I had a small exhaust leak on one of my cars. It only required tightening a few bolts. They performed the service and would not accept any money. They are my go to place for exhaust work in the area.

I have always enjoyed this place. Nothing is out of this world, but it is mostly consistently pretty good. Some of my menu favorites are the chili releno, Chicken burrito and the carnitas. Service is usually fast and friendly. The prices are very reasonable.

We love the Capital Grille. I am glad it is a chain, I feel very comfortable eating at one when I am travelling, knowing I will be in for a night of outstanding food and service. We have eaten at this location more than any other. It is hard to not rate this place 5 stars, everything is done just about perfectly. I usually always get steak here, and it never disappoints. The wine selection is excellent, the atmosphere is outstanding, and the service is professional and unobtrusive.
A dive bar with an interesting drink menu. service can be slow and apathetic, but other than that I like it.

A very cool place for Christmas items. They have much more selection than you usually will see. Want to do your lights and ornaments all in one color? They have you covered. I like to stop in once a year.
The pulled pork was just OK, not special. The sides were very nice. I would say it rates 3 stars at most.

We were somewhat disappointed with our meal here. Have they lost their way recently? The Gumbo of all things was bland, and lacking in the amount of seafood being in it. The shrimp creole was  just not good at all. The rest of the meal was fine, but overall this place was a let down.
The Long Center is a beautiful Rec center. The aquatics area is especially impressive. Adults and children can participate in all sorts of sports activities here.

Love Trader Joe's, hate the parking situation. They need a bigger lot, plain and simple. The problem is, there is no room to expand it. So this store will apparently have a permanent parking problem which makes it a bit of a nightmare to shop here. Much as I like the brand, I don't like coming to this store.
This place is kind of a dump. It is a nice place to stop and have a drink or two outside. I was not comfortable ordering any food here. It certainly does attract a diverse and interesting crowd.

They serve pretty decent southern Italian food here. I like the family style concept quite a bit. In addition it is lively and festive here. I have always had pasta as an entrée, and I always enjoy it.

I love the decor in Cheddars, It creates a welcoming ambiance when you dine here. The food is quite good also. I had the Key West Chicken and shrimp and enjoyed it quite a bit. The prices are very reasonable and our service was excellent.

Nice friendly dog loving folks at this pet salon. We feel really comfortable with them taking care of our pets. The salon has all kinds of great stuff inside. We had to buy the ultra cool harnesses they sell that glow in the dark, just couldn't resist them.

This is my favorite area flea market. It is very large, and you can easily spend a few hours here. There are vendors selling just about everything, food, plants, merchandise, sports equipment,  hot tubs, you name it.

Great store with great prices. They have an incredible selection of products. My downfall is when I go in here I tend to over shop and buy a bunch of stuff I don't need. But is hard to resist doing that when you are getting such good deals.
I ate here and thought is was OK. You can do much better than OK here in NOLA, so I would not be in a hurry to return.

The Croissants and pastries here are very good. You can dine in and get coffee or pick up the items to go, as we did. Lots of locals eat here and recommend it. They also have great assortment of cookies, tarts, cakes and other desert items, along with preparing crepes.

A very nice place to stay and visit New Orleans. You are in walking distance to the French Quarter. It seems to be a safe walk, you go right by the Police station on the way. We walked to the Quarter and back every day with no issues. The park is well set up and the sites are level, and paved. The facilities are nice here. They even have very good free coffee in the office, a big plus.

Oldsmar has dedicated lots of space to parks and they have some great ones. This place is just filled with recreational options. You can access the waterway here, play with your dogs and play all sorts of sports. We loved it here.

5 stars and just about perfect. We loved everything about this place, especially how steeped in tradition it is, while remaining quite dazzling on all levels. Service is impeccable and the food is outstanding. The current chef is doing an amazing job.  It is a bit hard to get reservations here as it is so popular, so book yours in advance.

This is a nice place to go for a Southern breakfast. We enjoyed it very much. We waited about 15 minutes to get a table on a Sunday morning. The coffee was very good and served right away, starting things off right. I had an omelet that was quite nice, and the biscuits and gravy, which I did not try looked very good as well. This place is very popular and crowded on weekends.

I love Trader Joe's. They have really good wine besides the 2 dollar bottles. They also stock a pretty good assortment of organics and gluten free items, all at great prices. I am happy that there is finally one in Florida that is in my occasional stomping grounds. I can't wait until we have one in my town of Orlando.

This is a rip off tourist trap. They charge about double the going rate for drinks. The place is filthy. My wife couldn't even use the bathroom here it was so nasty. The band was OK, too bad they have to work here. Don't waste your money here. One of the worst places on Bourbon Street.

They did a great job for me selling some furniture. They sent someone out to look at it, suggested some pricing that was agreeable, and took the furniture away. Within about 8 weeks, they had sold it all and sent me a check. I was very pleased with the transaction.

I was back in the St. Louis area visiting family and a very good friend took me to this place.  Let me say. WOW- I was very impressed by this place, the place looks amazing. Friendly fast service and the Alsatian - Vermont Crème Fraiche, Smoked Bacon, Caramelized Onions & Dante Cheese wood oven pizza was really amazingly delectable. 

If and when I ever come back to BelleVegas--- I must dine here.

When I lived in St. Louis I loved this place, in fact I came here for another going away party with 12 or more people and we all had a wonderful time.

I no longer love this place. I came here a few weeks ago when I was in town for work and upon arrival the hostesses gruff attitude and hurried personality already rubbed me wrong.  The server a blond woman perhaps in her middle 30's early 40's simply was not as personable or enjoyable I was hoping she would be. She was inattentive and it seemed that waiting on us was a chore.

The food just didnt seem to be of high quality and lacked the flavor and creativity it once had. The Scallops were unbelievably small I guess I am use to large scallops I often see here on the East Coast. I will give them kudos to preparing them correctly. The Lobster was ok, and the shrimp was nothing exciting.
Disappointed in Modesto.
Ehhh, it's just OK. Order Diner food and don't expect more.  St. Louis needs a nice diner. The staff need to pay attention as well.

This place only survives because it is in the airport, but otherwise it sucks. The food is better than the complete lack-luster un-attentive and verges on complete rude customer service. Better take it to go.

I wish Boston had a store like this. I love the selection and the quality swimsuits and underwear are unparalleled unless you shop online. AHH but you can, this place sports a huge online web store, but I still enjoy trying things on. I try to stop by every time I am in town.
Don't worry about going somewhere else for Vietnamese in St. Louis, this is the best.. That's it. the best!
Nothing pleases a girl more than finding out that there's an Arby's directly beside her hotel.  And, that it's open killer late!!

If you're looking to scoot away from the touristy area of New Orleans, Morrow's is definitely a place to go.  When my friend and I arrived, we were told it would be 45 minutes for a table.  They don't take reservations.  Fortunately, we were able to snag two seats at the bar.  The service was friendly.  We were seated between two locals that struck up conversation and gave us recommendations on things to do and places to go.  

The food was good, albeit delivery was slow.  Real slow.  It took over 30 minutes to get a cup of gumbo, and over an hour to get our oysters.  The oysters were worth the wait.  So delicious (we got the charbroiled ones).  Drinks and prices were on point.  

Great dinner spot before venturing over to Frenchman for some local jazz.

Cool concept, but unfortunately it lacks any creative execution.  Lots of pancakes to choose from.  I don't really like pancakes though, so was stuck getting some bacon and eggs.  I'd say the food quality compared to that you'd get at IHOP or Waffle House.  My meal came with some pancakes on the side.  I got the banana bread ones.  They were decent, but far from amazing.  Actually, I could have made them at home.  

This place is overhyped and not really worth the wait.  Also, they don't offer anything but basic coffee and juice out of a carton to drink.  This is a typical diner, which happens to offer a million different combinations of pancakes.  I wouldn't go out of my way to return.

Craving noodles in Reno, and there was basically one option, Minato Noodles.

I got the Tonkotsu noodles, which was surprisingly brothy and delicious. Nothing was overseasoned, and takoyaki was also delicious.

My only gripe would be the toppings in the ramen. My egg was not soft-boiled nor marinaded. There was a singular bamboo piece. And the pork was pretty thin, as far as Chasu goes. 

Also, to add ANY additional topping it is 2 dollars. They need to differentiate some of the prices, as I really don't want to be paying 2 dollars for half a hard-boiled egg, or a couple pieces of bamboo. The only additional topping that it warranted being 2 dollars was the Chasu, which was also pushing it.

Still, great place for ramen, I wouldn't order any add-ons.

This was by far one of my favorite places on my recent trip to New Orleans.  Our sweet bartender at dba overheard that I was a vegetarian and suggested my friend and I try it out.  The atmosphere is quaint, cute, and comfortable. It helped that we stopped by on a local artists showcase night.  I'll tell you, I never expected the best country voice I've heard live to come out of a scruffy looking hipster!  Service was very slow as it seemed they were running with two bartenders and no servers, but luckily the atmosphere and being on vacation cured any impatience I had.  

As far as food goes, our ceviche was delicious.  We also ordered the butternut ravioli with brown butter... which was lacking.  I didn't expect the ravioli to be sitting in an entire inch bath of brown butter and would have much preferred a light brush of it.  Overall though, I really enjoyed the selection and the tapas style dishes because who doesn't like sharing?

Frenchman was definitely my favorite area of Nola and Three Muses is a running contender for number one on that block.

We went to Gennaro's last week for the first time, because I had been told they have a really great outdoor patio.  My husband, daughter and I brought a friend who was visiting from the West Coast.  The server was really nice. Her and the mosaic covered patio were probably the best part of Gennaro's.  

As someone noted in another review, they don't have high chairs here. It seems rather odd considering its an average quality pizza place. Luckily, our daughter is tall enough not to need one, but I wouldn't have been super excited if I had a younger child. Also, the front door has a sign saying something along the lines of "Well behaved children are welcome." Ok Gennaro's, you aren't that great. Your pizza is a few steps above Pizza Hut.  The POPE is a pub up the street that is very welcoming to kids. Le Virtu is a pretty high end restaurant up the street that is very welcoming to kids. I can't imagine childless people are showing up in droves at Gennaro's when there is Brigantessa almost directly across the street (which by the way also has high chairs.)

Also, they served out food with paper plates. Seriously. We ended up paying over $50 for pretty bland pizza, super dry foccacia bread, and their version of sangria. And we ate it off of paper plates!

So all in all, it was ok. I don't imagine we would go there again considering there is much better pizza available at much more child friendly places in the area.  But if you want to sit outside on a really pretty and shady patio and aren't worried about having the "best" pizza, it would probably serve your needs.

We stopped in here today for lunch, because my daughter wanted pizza. They have a kid's menu that's the expected stuff (pasta, mac and cheese, burger, etc) Her kid's cheese pizza was $7, and it was a really big pizza. It would have been to much for me as an adult, so a pretty good deal. I got a cup of French onion soup, my husband got the clam chowder special. Mine was really good, not to much cheese like some places. We also split the grilled cheese which had bacon on it and  came with fries. It came on thick Texas toast type bread, not flat bread like the menu says, but I liked it that way. All in all, a very solid decently priced lunch in Olde City. I'd definitely go again.

One of the best freshest Rock Crab I've ever had in my life. 

It was a late late late dinner. Did I mention how late we came in? We came 45 minutes before closing because we got to Santa Barbara late. The place is just 4 minutes car ride from where we stayed. 

When we came in, the place is almost packed and we proceeded to the corner booth.

So we ordered the Rock Crab and my wife ordered the Cioppino. What the hell is a Cioppino? For those of you who don't know a Cioppino, it's seafood chowder on steroid on a sourdough bread. And a side order of Onion Ring.

As we waited for our dinner, I noticed people still coming in until closing time.

When I ordered the crab, I was afraid not being able to finish them all. Well I was wrong... and full at the same time :)

Rock Crab came out fresh with a side of butter.

Cioppino was just a complete massive dish by itself

Gigantic Onion Rings to top our dinner off.

I was full, sleepy and felt guilty for staying almost an hour past their last call. As I paid our bill, I apologize for staying late. The waiter was all smile and said not to worry.
